definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: I rang again and a maid with a sullen face opened the door .
sentences.chinese: 我又揿了一下门铃，一名侍女紧绷着脸把门开了。

sentences.english: Sometimes M. Mabeuf started at the sound of the bell.
sentences.chinese: 有时马白夫先生听到门铃响而惊动起来。

sentences.english: A few minutes later I hear the doorbell ring and it's Annabelle at the door.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟以后，我听到门铃环和它的安娜贝勒在门口。

sentences.english: It was 4 o'clock when the front doorbell rang. Mrs. Clarke was making tea at the time.
sentences.chinese: 四点的时候门铃响了，这时克拉克太太正在烧茶。

sentences.english: He is too short to reach the door bell.
sentences.chinese: 他太矮以致于搆不到门铃。

sentences.english: I kept ringing the doorbell but nobody answered.
sentences.chinese: 我一直按门铃，但没人开门。

sentences.english: The doorbell rang, and there were roses, sitting by her door.
sentences.chinese: 门铃再次响起，又是一束玫瑰，放在她的门前。

sentences.english: Most of more than two persons, suddenly the doorbell rang and found it was a bright and cheerful disposition.
sentences.chinese: 二人争持不下，突然门铃一响，发现竟然是开朗。

sentences.english: The bell twinkles when you open the door.
sentences.chinese: 一开门，门铃就叮当作响。

sentences.english: She walked into my room without bothering to ring the bell first.
sentences.chinese: 她连先按下门铃都懒得按一下就走进了我的房间。

sentences.english: Don't want no bright lights, false teeth, doorbells, landlords.
sentences.chinese: 我不想要耀眼的灯光，假牙，门铃，房东。

sentences.english: He sees a little boy ringing a door bell on tiptoe.
sentences.chinese: 他看到一个小男孩踮着脚按门铃。

sentences.english: The bell rang again, and the next moment she heard her letter-box being pushed open.
sentences.chinese: 门铃又响了，接着她就听到自己的信箱被打开了。

sentences.english: I had just fallen asleep when the doorbell rang.
sentences.chinese: 我刚入睡，门铃突然响了起来。

sentences.english: How do you think I rang the doorbell?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我是怎么把门铃按响的？

sentences.english: If the door bell or telephone rings, ignore it or take the baby with you to answer it.
sentences.chinese: 如果门铃或者电话铃响，不应理采它或让宝宝去接听。

definition: to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
